By focusing on the historical development of financial systems and institutions, you can present sessions that offer students a contextual understanding. This approach not only enhances their comprehension, but also encourages critical thinking about global economies. Reading assignments on financial history can be a great way to engage students in learning financial literacy. By focusing on significant historical events and their impact on markets, you can provide students with valuable context.
